docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton became the latest high-profile Democrat to back the re-election bids of Gov. Pat Quinn and U.S. Sen. Dick Durbin, saying Tuesday that the candidates focus on issues important to voters, like jobs and health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: First lady Michelle Obama stumped for Democrats in Iowa and Minnesota Tuesday, calling on the young and minority voters who powered her husband's rise to the presidency to help the party avoid a potentially bruising midterm election.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Fowle was released after nearly six months of captivity, officials said. The United States is working on freeing two others held by North Korea.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and RICK GLADSTONE

docs.snippet: Mr. Fowle was released after nearly six months of captivity, officials said. The United States is working on freeing two others held by North Korea....
docs.abstract: Jeffrey E Fowle, one of three Americans imprisoned by North Korea, is on his way home following nearly six months of captivity; American officials are still trying to secure the release of the other two prisoners, Matthew Todd Miller and Kenneth Bae.

headline.print_headline: American Held by North Korea Is Freed
headline.main: Jeffrey Fowle, American Held by North Korea, Is Freed
